column4: Linux_Titan:logout, CTL+ALT+F1 for TTY. /etc/init.d/gdm stop. then run it.
I have done that, I know that part well. The problem lies in the fact that despite my chmod -x command the file remains unexecutable
Go into gnome and check with right click properties to see if its set to executable. Double check thats all.
btw all of that can be done simply by opening a terminal window and typing "sudo stop gdm"
